author: Valentin Rusu
message: Maybe off-topic, but... for documentation needs I use asciidoc and it's relative named asciidoctor, after several attempts with other systems. It simply works!

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Asciidoc is a great format, but the code I am documenting is written in Python, and the de-facto markup standard for code documentation in Python is rst, so I choose to follow this way. The great force of Docutils is how extensible it is, though I see one can extend Asciidoc as well, might give it a try later. Asciidoc markup sure looks nicer than rst.
